name: Quinoa and Black Bean Chili from GOYA®
author: Goya
summary: Enjoy a healthful, vegetarian meal packed with protein and flavor! In this hearty recipe, GOYA® Low Sodium Black Beans are cooked with onions, a medley of spices, rich tomato sauce, bell peppers and a hint of smoky chipotle. Once ready, the chili is mixed with GOYA® Organic Quinoa and corn, and garnished with fresh cilantro sprigs for an extra touch of flavor. This chili is good, and good for you, too!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon GOYA® Extra Virgin Olive Oil
2 (15.5 ounce) cans GOYA® Low Sodium Black Beans, drained and rinsed
½ large green bell pepper, seeded and diced
½ large red bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 tablespoon GOYA® Chipotle Peppers, in Adobo Sauce, finely chopped
1 (15.5 ounce) can GOYA® Corn Kernels, drained and rinsed
directions: In a medium pot, bring quinoa, 1 1/2 cups water and 1/2 of olive oil to a boil
Reduce heat, cover and let simmer for 20 minutes, until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender
Meanwhile, in a large pot, heat remaining olive oil on medium-high heat
Add onion and garlic, and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add chili powder, cumin and oregano, and stir for about 1 minute
Stir in tomato sauce, black beans, green and red peppers, chipotle peppers and 1 cup water
Bring to a boil; then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes
After 20 minutes, stir in reserved quinoa and corn
Serve and top with fresh cilantro sprigs
